law.catch_line: The Commission consists of five commissioners, appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent...

text.section: The Commission consists of five commissioners, appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.

section.section: Each commissioner shall be a registered voter of the State.

The Commission shall be:
broadly representative of the geographic and demographic diversity of the State and of the public; and
composed of individuals with diverse training and experience.

text.section: Each commissioner shall devote full time to the duties of office.

section.section: The term of a commissioner is 5 years and begins on July 1.
The terms of commissioners are staggered as required by the terms in effect for commissioners on July 1, 2006.
At the end of a term, a commissioner continues to serve until a successor qualifies.
A commissioner who is appointed after a term has begun serves for the rest of the term and until a successor qualifies.

text.section: Before taking office, each appointee to the Commission shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.
The Governor may remove a commissioner for incompetence or misconduct in accordance with § 3-307 of the State Government Article.
